info.name: Design
info.blurb: Welcome to my design portfolio! I have on display here all my projects that showcase my technical skills and eye for design. Mainly, my technical skills lie in Figma, the Adobe Suite including Illustrator and InDesign, and Rhino. This page will be constantly updated with my new projects, so keep an eye out!  To see my Software Development work, take a look at my Coding Portfolio!

entries.name: HotSpot Design
entries.blurb: This design involved several iterations of prototyping and running user tests. I experimented with several versions, and ran them by groups of users. I landed on this final design, and made several mockups in Figma.

entries.name: MIC Brand Refresh
entries.blurb: Upon entering the Music Industry at Columbia board as the Design Director, I met with the rest of the board to imagine a brand identity refresh. This club was the brainchild of the current president, so it was very important for me to preserve her passion and mission in the new design guidelines. This invovled creating a set of colors, fonts, and design styles that would work with the themes of the club.

entries.name: Baci Brand Design
entries.blurb: Baci is the passion-project and senior thesis of the Head Chef, and required an immense amount of self-sacrifice and committment. Upon joining Baci, I noticed that there was little in the way of brand or concept. Thus, I created a logo and uniform for the supper club that preserved the personality of the head chef, remaining playful while takiing things very seriously.

entries.name: Graphic Design Portfolio Zine
entries.blurb: I love zines, especially how a concept can be captured and performed in the bounds of sheets of folded-A4 paper. When it came time to collect a portfolio, I knew I didn't want to just submit a folder of loose work. I designed this zine to encapsulate and present my work with more intention than I could manage otherwise.

entries.name: Inside Out Radio Station
entries.blurb: This was the final project for the Architecture class Systems and Materials. In this project, I flipped a physical space I was familiar with, the Columbia Radio Station, inside out. Upon this exploration, I discovered several relationships and connections that I solidified into this model, making considerations on material and construction process.

entries.name: Lunar New Year Poster
entries.blurb: In this poster, I worked on developing my own style, as well as more skills with Adobe Illustrator. I was inspired by maximalist works I had recently seen, and intended to make something that was simultaneously sensorily overwhelming and cohesive.

entries.name: Social System Chair
entries.blurb: This was my first exploration into Architecture. In this project, I identified a social system in my personali life, that of the mailroom line that invovled two queues that crossed each other. I designed this chair to change up that social system, changing the intersection into a round-a-bout type interaction.

entries.name: Got Milk? Poster
entries.blurb: The purpose of this poster was as an exercise of logo-making and illustrative design.

entries.name: Personal Website
entries.blurb: I designed this website on Figma before developing and deploying it. Here, I worked on the most visually-appealing way to display information I was very familiar with.
